column2: INDIANA DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
1. A traffic light shows both a red light and a green arrow. The driver may not turn in the direction of the arrow until the red light has changed.
2. What is the first thing to do when you make a three-point turn?
column4: Signal with your left turn signal, then check carefully for traffic coming toward you.
column6: Signal with your right turn signal, then pull over to the right and stop.
column8: Turn left, go across the road so you come to a stop while you face the edge of the road.

column2: 3. The picture shows a _________ sign.
4. When they see a yellow X signal, drivers should:
column4: prepare to leave the lane safely.
column6: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 5. You can reduce the chance of a collision with a large vehicle if you:
column4: cut abruptly in front of it.
column8: pay close attention to the turn signals.
column10: pull in front of the large vehicle before you can see the whole front of the vehicle in your mirror.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column4: Drivers cannot make a complete turn to go in the opposite direction.
column8: Left turns are not allowed where this sign is displayed.
column10: Vehicles turning left must make a U-turn.

column2: 7. A thumping sound can be a warning:
column8: that a tire blowout is about to occur.

column2: 8. When a bicyclist is approaching on the right, drivers turning right must let the bicyclist go through the intersection first before making a right turn.
9. This road sign means:
10. In urban areas, drivers moving out of an alley, private road or driveway need not come to a complete stop before entering the roadway if the roadway is clear of traffic.
21. What does a flashing left yellow arrow mean?
column4: Left turns are allowed. Yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.
column8: Vehicles turning left must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.

column2: 22. After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
column6: Yes, but only if oncoming vehicles or bicycles are at least 10 feet away.
column8: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.

column2: 23. This sign means:
column6: Bicycles should yield to vehicles ahead.
column8: The lane ahead is reserved for bicycles.
column10: Warning: a bikeway crosses the roadway ahead.

column2: 24. Examples of proper glass maintenance include:
column6: Making sure there is enough windshield fluid in the reservoir.
column8: Keeping your windows clean and clear.

column2: 25. Your car must have a horn that can be heard from a distance of 200 feet.
26. Drivers may pass another vehicle by driving on the shoulder of the road.
27. What should you do if a vehicle is approaching head-on in your lane?
column4: Pull over to the left and use your emergency lights to stop the other driver.
column6: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other driver.
column8: Come to a complete stop and use your horn to warn the vehicles behind you.
column10: Turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.

column2: 28. A vehicle that enters a road from a driveway:
column4: must yield to traffic approaching from the right, while it has the right-of-way over vehicles approaching from the left.
column6: must stop and yield the right-of-way to traffic on the roadway and to pedestrians.

column2: 29. BAC is expressed in:
column10: ounces of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 30. Where there is no bicycle lane, where on the road must a bicyclist ride?
column4: near the right curb or edge of the road.
column6: near the left edge of the road.
column8: on the left shoulder of the road.

column2: 31. Drivers should check their rearview mirrors:
column4: often to see how traffic is moving behind them.
column8: to see if a truck is in their blind spot.

column2: 32. This road sign means:
33. Parking is not allowed:
column6: on the road side of a parked vehicle.

column2: 34. When riding in a vehicle equipped with air bags is, children ages 12 and under are safer:
column4: in the bed of a pick-up truck.
column6: buckled up in the front seat.
column8: buckled up in the back seat.

column2: 35. The BMV may require drivers 21 years of age and older who are convicted of 2 or more traffic offenses within a 12-month period to complete a BMV-approved DSP course.
36. Following another vehicle too closely is known as:
37. If you have an Indiana credential, you must notify the BMV of a change of your principal address within 30 days of the address change.
38. Drivers are required to stop within how many feet of the nearest railroad crossing when a train is approaching?
39. This sign means:
column4: No parking between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column6: Parking is not allowed at 8:30 AM and at 5:30 PM
column8: You can only park between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.

column2: 40. Vertical panels, barricades, drums and cones are the most commonly used devices to guide drivers safely through work zones.
41. This road sign is:
42. This sign means:
column6: Left turns in both directions of travel are not permitted.
column8: The center lane is shared for left turns.

column2: 43. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, you must:
column4: move into the left lane, or to the left side of a single lane.
column6: move into the right lane, or to the right side of a single lane.
column8: move into the right lane, or to the left side of a single lane.

column2: 44. For protection, motorcyclists are required to:
column4: keep their headlights and taillights on at all times.
column6: signal turns, lane changes and stops.

column2: 45. When they approach this sign, drivers must:
column4: slow down and watch for children crossing the road.

column2: 46. On average, how long does it take your body to remove the alcohol contained in 5 ounces of wine?
47. If you are involved in or come upon a traffic crash, you should stop your vehicle in a safe, well-lighted public place that does not obstruct traffic, if able to do so.

49. The driver of an emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can legally:
50. When driving at night with no other vehicles ahead, a driver should use:
